content.label: The number of levels is seriously misleading. When I bought this game, I looked at the reviews and saw some of them talking about “level 303” or level “101” but really 101 is level 1 and level 303 is 3 in the third world, and there are only 10 levels per world, with a few bonuses. I thought I was getting a lot more value for my two dollars than I was actually getting, and that alone ruins the experience for me.
Great complex game but i completed all the levels in a short week.

Great game. The music is a bit haunting, like the isolation of outer-space. The challenge ramps up nicely, and the bonus levels can be quite difficult.
I’ve been working on the last two levels for some time now. I’ll admit I looked up solutions to a couple of levels, but I’m determined to solve these last two on my own.
Thank you to the developer for fixing the bug on 4-14!

Whenever I trigger a paradox the tiles can no longer be turned, so the only way to fix it is to reset the entire puzzle. There’s no way this isn’t a bug, it’s incredibly frustrating when this happens in the later levels...

It’s amazing the amount of work and thinking it took to make this game. I really enjoy it.

A couple things I think are bugs—
Sometimes when I turn an arrow and the game detects a paradox, I can no longer turn the arrow again to get it out of the paradox. Since the arrows only turn counterclockwise, sometimes I can’t get the arrow to the direction I really want it.
Also, the achievement “level 310 in 16 segments” — I’m completing it in 16 segments, but the game is not awarding the achievement.

Thanks! And again, great game!

Let me just say one thing about this game, it’s complicated. If you aren’t into very challenging puzzle games, then this isn’t for you. But, putting all that aside, this beautiful game is very fun and very unique! The concepts are very cool and the sound is also crisp and clean in my opinion. Highly recommended for anyone who has patience and skill. Great work to all the developers 👍

This is one of the most beautifully crafted strategy games I’ve ever played. It has everything from clever concept to lively artwork to thought provoking music. I highly recommend this game a hundred times over.

title.label: I will go ahead and say it....

content.label: Chu Chu RocketMan!

Awesome game, really unique concept.  If you like challenging logic puzzles, go on and get your $2 out.

I just finished the last puzzle and have already been to the devs website looking for more!

RE:  Puzzle #410 - wow, what a mind bender 😱
I spent 3 days on that one.

The worst kinds of puzzle games are the ones where you accidentally solve the puzzles because you absolutely don’t understand how it works.  This is one of those types of games.

I got to the portal stages and have no idea of what the branch on the timeline  means and why I suddenly spawn another character...but hey, I’m suddenly solving them without any idea of what’s going on.

Please add a tutorial.
I can’t quite put my finger on why it’s not enjoyable, but it is not a very joyful game. It feels like just solving math problems.

Really enjoying this game. Very clever puzzles and very challenging. Great job. 

My only complaint is the lack of iCloud backups. I love playing on my iPad but don’t want to take it with me everywhere I go. This is a great pick up and play game. Any chance you can add iCloud backup?

I can’t get over the initial depressingly eerie music as I tried to figure out how it works. The choice of sounds is so deeply downing on my spirit and feels so haunting to one’s soul that I could barely tolerate it less than a minute.  It was too much of a distraction and there’s no point playing an app game without the accompaniment of background music in it. Too bad because I loved the visuals of the game and it’s cool concepts. It’s why a 2 stars instead of just one.  Hopefully, am only a few that’s bothered by( to me ) a horrific depressing choice of sounds chosen by its developers.  No choice but had to removed it. First time I tried an app game less than a minute, or was it 30 seconds?  Oh well, from most of the reviews, I’m not worry of the effects of my one review.   Have fun if you’re not bothered by the sounds! GL!
Needlessly complicated without adding enjoyment

No instructions((
I’m not much of a gamer or puzzler,but really I couldn't even get past the first screen.No help...anywhere.
So deleted it....unpleasant experience.

title.label: Another sucky recommendation from the Editor

content.label: Crazily basic and boring.  Save your time and instead petition for Apple to fire this dude as Editor

I typically download then delete games quickly, but this one had me hooked until I cleared every level. I’ve never had so much fun playing a mobile game before. It’s the perfect balance between challenging and fun, it makes you use your noggin rather than rely on speed or accuracy, and it has a great time travel twist that forces the player to use logic to solve paradoxes and such. Highly recommended for any puzzle and/or sci-fi nerd!

title.label: Must play for time travel enthusiasts

content.label: Once time travel is introduced into this game, it’s simply mind blowing. You can even create paradoxes! It’s so satisfying to simply rewind the game right before you solve it and watch your solution run from beginning to end. I can’t imagine the work it takes to think up these puzzles. Great job devs.

313 is also broken. After watching a walkthrough on YouTube the video shows something that is literally impossible to duplicate because once one of the arrows is switched the ghost completely disappears. Otherwise great game

title.label: Good Game One Flaw Unless I’m Missing Something

content.label: This is a very innovative game. I’m just through level 115. However unless I’m missing something I can’t believe that after you complete a level when you return to it you cannot play it again! This seems like such a simple way that it should work... return to a completed level and it remembers your solution until you click reset. This is so serious to me I’m deducting two stars.
Too many people are saying it makes no sense. Fantastic game!
Very polished
Great concept and good (if somewhat buggy) execution.  However, the game experience was tainted for me in that the audio quits frequently and doesn't return until I reboot my new 10.5" iPad.

Great game.  I had to skip level 307 because in my version, it simply doesn't work.  I resorted to looking at the solution, and it's not what happens on my iPhone 6.  In the shown solution, after creating the ghost, you turn away from the transporter, and continue with the astronaut and the ghost.  But in fact, on my iPhone at least, when I turn away from the transporter, the ghost disappears.  Otherwise, great game, only had to cheat twice (not counting level 307).
This just feels like a fancy version of a Rubik's cube. If you like those, maybe you'll enjoy this. I however thought it was very dull.  Disappointed.
The best mobile game I've ever played. Mind blowing. Can't say enough. A bit reminiscent of Braid.
Great game, very challenging levels while still not being unbeatable. Loved it.

title.label: I Didn't Find it Fun at All

content.label: The game looked fun but I was frustrated by the characters lack of logic. It seems like there may be a pattern to when they turn without an arrow but I can't play it long enough to find out. I got through a few levels but it was pretty tedious. Looks good with no lag on iPhone 7 Plus.
Big waste, makes no sense. Like so many other "featured" apps it is not worth the download.
Kind of cool but lack of instruction and nonsensical level progression make this a dud

Good game really. 
Days ago everyone I know who played this game can not go through level 410. I myself spent several days trying on it, and finally I believe this level is physically unable to be solved. But now it is solved. Challenging.
Want to be able to play on multiple devices.
The screen flashes and blurs while playing.  So annoying.  This needs to be fixed!  I already deleted the app and downloaded again twice--  Same result.  I would not recommend.
I'm downloading again to give it another chance. I enjoyed playing through the first world but then the game crashed and wouldn't let me start it up again. Please fix!

Really have enjoyed this game from start to finish. I give it 5 stars because I couldn't put this down once I started it... and couldn't play anything else until I beat it. Challenging? Sure... fair? Always. 

TOUGH AS NAILS at some points... but really, there's always an answer. Sit back and think through it.
Can't even PLAY THE GAME!  Upon opening it now, there is no start button anymore?  No way to even play it!  Save your money. This game is WORTHLESS!!!!

This is a wonderful game. The mechanic involving time travel is unique, creative, and generates challenging puzzles.

It is most certainly not simple or repetitive. (I can only imagine that those who say otherwise didn't play many levels). 

The levels are exquisitely designed. There are not too many, and the difficulty ramps up nicely. Some of the final levels are truly brilliant (and very hard!)

I don't remember this app costing $1.99. I recently saw the receipt in my email ,causing me much confusion. I definitely wouldn't BUY an app i know nothing about. 
For the game itself , it's crap . It's not interesting at all. Reminds me of a bad coolmath game.

Waste of money.  Not user friendly at all. Screen blurs when going backwards ... gives me a headache ... no other game ever did that.  Not worth it even if it was free.  I see why they don't offer a free trial ... no one would pay for this.  Can't believe I paid money for something that gives me a headache.
Not worth it for this one. Beautifully made game, just not any fun. Wish I could get my money back.

title.label: Video glitch FX ruins this game!

content.label: There is a rewind video glitch effect that is obviously done on purpose, but it absolutely ruins what could a great game.
Opened it yesterday, played a few levels. Came back to it today, the play/start button is gone. There's no way to play the game. Just see the splash screen and the settings menu.

I love playing around with time and using it to solve puzzles is a pretty fun Mechanic. 

Only issues:
1. Game crashes if you lock your phone while it's running.

2. I wish there were a "replay" feature for when you finish a puzzle. One of them are very complex and I want to rewind to watch it all play out, but once you finish the level it warps you to the next one right away. No time to admire your accomplishment.
This game looked interesting, but it's not exactly challenging. Puzzles take little to no thought to solve.
Unthrilling

I love this game. It is so fun to play when you bored. Addicting and challenging. Graphics and artwork are great. Good game concept. Would like more levels! Great game, worth the money, would recommend.
Could use a bit more variety of levels, but original and challenging.
A pretty great puzzle game that doesn't penalize you for making a mistake, is challenging and throws in a bunch of extra levels.

It's a good enough game, but I can't play because it makes me nauseous. There needs to be a setting to turn off the video scrubbing effect when you rewind the timeline. The visual distortion effects when you do that makes me ill.

Wow this is an awesome game.  Really well done.  The difficulty of the levels ramps up nicely, and the mechanic is unique among puzzle games I've played.

But for the love of everything you hold dear, PLEASE LET US SAVE OUR SOLUTIONS ON EACH LEVEL. C'mon, for a mind-bending puzzle game like this, that is crucial.

Love it on level 309 how you can cause a paradox, AND THE GAME DETECTS IT and shows you that.  Amazing!
